page.title: 12ARMED FORCES-SEARCH/RESCUE
page.content: "Search and Rescue"is a small part of the operations at Culdrose but it is probably what the base is most famous for to the public in Cornwall.The Squadron works with the local rescue services of RNLI,Coastguards and Surf-Life Saving Clubs. Wessex helicopters fly S.A.R."from dawn to dusk".The aircraft are all kitted out to deal with emergencies with first aid gear and equipment for a diver.On the wheels of the Wessex is a pack containing an inflatable bag in case the helicopter has to land on water in an emergency.It will keep it afloat long enough for the crew to get out.Night missions or long distances are usually flown by Sea Kings. Culdrose helicopters flew to help at the recent schoolboys disaster at Lands End and the Air India crash off Ireland.
